description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ad3pd","text":"This animal protocol was approved by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee of the Indiana University School of Medicine and the Methodist Research Institute, Indianapolis, IN, and conformed to the Guide for Care and Use of Laboratory Animals. The surgical procedure is performed under anesthesia and should incorporate all local requirements for standards of animal experimentation, including methods of anesthesia, surgical environment, and post-operative monitoring and care. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c4vm3","text":"Under isoflurane inhalation general anesthesia, perform left thoracotomy through the 4th intercostal space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9t2k0","text":"Implant a radio transmitter (D70-EEE, Data Sciences International), InterStim II neurostimulator (Medtronic Inc.), and a modified Secura implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) (Medtronic Inc.).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":27},{"key":1,"offset":98,"length":14},{"key":2,"offset":183,"length":14}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"35AEBC56473511EC91020A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://datasci.in-development.ca/home"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"35AEBCA0473511EC91020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.medtronic.com/us-en/index.html"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"35AEBCDC473511EC91020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.medtronic.com/us-en/index.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68khi","text":"Connect 3 pairs of bipolar electrodes to D70-EEE to record:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9112q","text":"Left stellate ganglion nerve activity (SGNA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1roq6","text":"Left thoracic vagal nerve activity (VNA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fad54","text":"Subcutaneous nerve activity (ScNA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2sfl5","text":"Blindly insert a quadripolar sacral stimulating lead (Medtronic Inc., model 3889) into the subcutaneous fat layer under the cutaneous trunci muscle and connect it to InterStim II in a subcutaneous pocket.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"98l0r","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"4C5C3BA9473511EC91020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.medtronic.com/us-en/index.html"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"4C5C3D87473511EC91020A58A9FEAC02","height":271,"id":186819,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":43,"offset":8}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e5uvs","text":"Source: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.hrthm.2020.09.009","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"FBD805D0440011ECAFC76F83FA8F045A","url":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.hrthm.2020.09.009"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Fig 1.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fycmbn4uf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fyqdbn4uf.jpg","url":"https://www.medtronic.com/us-en/index.html","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fyqcbn4uf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3snvu","text":"To record ScNA bracket the point of stimulation with a pair of bipolar electrodes from D70-EEE placed in the subcutaneous tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"687hv","text":"Screw a 5076 screw-in pacing lead (Medtronic Inc.) into the left atrial appendage and connect it to a modified Secura ICD for rapid atrial pacing to induce sustained AF.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":14}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"62BF0194473511EC91020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.medtronic.com/us-en/index.html"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ddhvi","text":"Turn off the defibrillator function of the ICD.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mstm","text":"2 weeks after the surgery turn on D70-EEE for baseline recording of ECG and nerve activities (NA) during sinus rhythm (SR).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14j9h","text":"2 weeks post surgery turn on D70-EEE. After baseline recording of ECG and NA during sinus rhythm (SR), turn on the ICD.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"256sq","text":"The ICD should deliver high rate continuous atrial pacing (600 bpm, 2X the diastolic threshold output) for at least 3 weeks to induce persistent AF (\u003e48 hours).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14d27","text":"Halt the pacing protocol every 3 weeks to determine if sustained AF was induced. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9r1t3","text":"Repeat the protocol until sustained AF is induced and study data as the baseline of the sustained AF.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfc7e","text":"After the baseline recording during SR and sustained AF, turn on the neurostimulator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dr777","text":"Weekly measure the impedance and adjust the voltage output to maintain the desired current output for 4 weeks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dtip1","text":"After ScNS for 4 weeks turn off the neurostimulator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqj7g","text":"In 3.5 mA and 0.25 mA groups:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48it6","text":"Program the neurostimulator to 20-s ON and 60-s OFF (10 Hz, 450 μs pulse width).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71jp6","text":"Program the output current (mA) to deliver ScNS at 3.5 mA group and 0.25 mA group. Progressively increase the output until the desired level is reached.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qohm","text":"In sham group:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10d88","text":"Program the output current to 0 mA (sham stimulation).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"83i21","text":"Turn on D70-EEE to record final post ScNS state.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5o6u","text":"Euthanize animals and harvest tissues for additional readouts if needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Subcutaneous nerve stimulation in canine model of persistent atrial fibrillation
title_html: Subcutaneous nerve stimulation in canine model of persistent atrial fibrillation
